answers.answer: "Is there a possibility that this will be a temporary diabetes due to stress n tensions n will go away with some time?"If he has been experiencing high stress and tension levels over a period of time I'm afraid not, not with glucose [blood sugar] levels that you posted. Whatever is causing the stress and tension must be addressed. Doing so will help his levels. In any case, he must also make lifestyle changes; adhere to proper diabetic nutrition, maintain proper body weight, and perform daily physical exercise. These, along with medication, help with lowering glucose levels.Google diabetes side effects, print them out and hand it to him. They are not myths and do not go away if ignored. If he works hard at lowering his glucose levels he has a good chance of living a normal life.

I'm sure stress played a big part with my diagnosis of type 2 last August. My wife had a stroke in mid June and was hospitalized for six weeks. Fortunately she came home almost 100%. So the stress was alleviated.Diabetes is not temporary but it can be controlled by lifestyle changes as outlined above. Encourage your friend to go see a registered dietician. I was told to limit carbs to 60 to 75 per meal which I have done. without exception.
